intro: Cornutia coerulea, commonly known as the blue cornutia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form and produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are typically dark green and leathery, adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Cornutia coerulea is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
